intro: Gypsophila acutifolia var. gmelinii, commonly known as the Gmelin’s sweet pea flower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, clustered blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are white or pale pink, with a slight fragrance, and bloom in late summer. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
